==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=冃,冐}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|冃|t1=hat|目|t2=eyes|ls=ic}} – a hat over the eyes, not looking ahead – rash. Etymology clearer in alternative form {{zh-l|冐}}; in this form {{zh-l|*冃}} more closely resembles {{zh-l|*日}}.

===Etymology 1===
Original meaning was “to cover”.

Sino-Tibetan. {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} connects it with {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*muːŋ ~ r/s-muːk||sky, clouds, fog, dark, covered}}, whence {{cog|my|မိုး||sky; rain; to hold something over the head; roof}}, {{cog|bo|མུ}}, {{m|bo|དམུ}}, {{m|bo|རྨུ}}, {{m|bo|སྨུ||(''archaic'') sky}}.

Derivative: {{och-l|帽|hat}}.
